website_summaries.verdict: Featuring an innovative design that adjusts to grow with your puppy, this affordable option delivers fantastic value for money.
pros: Fully height adjustable to see your pup through every stage of growth
Stainless steel bowls are hygienic and easy to clean
Features a wide spill ridge to keep floors clean
Folding legs make it easy to store between meals or take along on trips
cons: It's not as heavy as some, but tipping is easily prevented by placing it against a wall

customer_reviews.title: Forget about the bad reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the quality since some people say it's flimsy and crappy plastic, but I have mine against the wall and have no issues. I bought this to prevent neck pain for my dog that a bowl on the floor may cause. He seems to be eating more often, but does still take some food into his mouth and put it on the floor and eat a piece at a time, so maybe this purchase wasn't necessary. He tends to push his food around with his nose and the stand hasn't shook at all. I'd say the quality is great for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelfel

customer_reviews.title: Maximus loves his new bowl stand he doesn't have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Maximus loves his new bowl stand he doesn't have to bend to put any aches on his neck it took him a minute to eat & drink he had to sniff it out first but overall were both happy
customer_reviews.author: Dy

customer_reviews.title: Finn Approved!
customer_reviews.text: It will feel slightly flimsy at first, but it literally just takes putting it against wall and you have yourself an awesome product! As you can see, my Finn loves it! He drinks A LOT of water throughout that day and now I don't have to fill his bowl every hour or two. Also, he tends to spill more water than he drinks, and with the bigger bowl and the stand, I no longer have water all over my floors! Would buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Isabela

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking stand and works fairly well but....
customer_reviews.text: Nice stand and works great for my 75lb Lab. Bowls are good size but not as heavy duty as they could be. Stand is sturdy enough and he does not push it around. I don’t see him knocking it over. Is smaller than I thought I would be, but honestly, it works as intended. Looks nicer than the ones at the pet stores. UPDATE: the top of the stand has a ridge around it, as well as around the bowl holes, and water collects all across the top of the stand. Big mess. Going back. I’ll keep looking for a better design as I like the elevated stand for feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay for purpose, but flaws make it unusable.
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks of use, the metal bowl rusted, leaving flakes of rust in the dog's water bowl. It is easy to assemble, and works well for the purpose, but because of the ridges, when the dog drinks water, it traps water along the edges and is hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie L.

customer_reviews.title: Serious Buyer’s Remorse.
customer_reviews.text: The item is made of cheap brittle black plastic with flimsy dented metal bowels made in India. The item is over priced for what you are getting. It’s the same quality as an item you’d find at a dollar store. Serious buyer’s remorse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonite

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Large 95lb pit bull
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical because I have such a large old man (dog) but it was actually perfect for him! The bowls are a lil small but he's on a diet anyway so it worked out for me. It seems pretty sturdy, he hasn't knocked anything over an its perfect for his neck. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Baromeo

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising!
customer_reviews.text: The photos on Amazon and the box this product came in have 2 stickers that say "Made in USA" The instructions that came with the item say "Made in China". The bowls say "Made in India." Clearly false advertising!
customer_reviews.author: jla

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for my dog who is 115 lbs and lab/shepherd mix. He doesn't have to bend over for his food anymore. It is sturdy and easily put together and taken a part for travel. I haven't had to adjust to smaller levels as the way it is in the picture is how we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Parker

customer_reviews.title: Rusty and not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: This is a lie. These bowls are not stainless steel and they started rusting after only a few weeks of use which is extremely dangerous for animals consuming water from these bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Tips Over @ Mid-Height
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to say that I *love* it, but I can't. I have it set at the mid-height and with the water dish filled, it tips over and spills due to being unbalanced (weight). It probably works best at full height, but my dog isn't quite tall enough.
customer_reviews.author: AMD

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: While item may look nice it is not sturdy. The legs do not lock in. This makes it wobbly. Unless your pet will not come in contact with the item it will stand up. Just putting food into the bowls will tip it over.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: lack of stability for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our bullmastiff. It was tall enough for him but had no stability. All he did was bump it and it would fall over. I suggest something more stable for large breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rice

customer_reviews.title: My $10 purchase at Homegoods was much better!
customer_reviews.text: The ratings were hit and miss but I decided to give it a try. Even if you put it against a wall it's still wobbly. There's constantly water on the dish as even a little bump into it splashes it all around. When my dog gently drinks the water it gets all over. I have a 45 lb Lab. My $10 purchase at Homegoods was much better!
customer_reviews.author: EWebb

customer_reviews.title: Will tip over if weight is put on the edge.
customer_reviews.text: I was proud to see it was made in the USA but its poorly crafted. It was ok til the cat put her paws on it to see what's in the dog bowl and it flipped over spilling all the water and food on the floor. The legs should be spread outward not just up and down like this is. I only bought it because it was made in the USA and the sale price. I'm keeping 1 of the 2 I bought and make my own lets out of wood. Its a great price for a dual bowl so its worth keeping it and making legs for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: We have an older mid-sized dog. She has developed a problem with neck and shoulder stiffness which we felt was being exacerbated by having to bend down to eat & drink from her bowls. We purchased the adjustable dog feeder to raise her bowls to a level that minimized her neck bending. The Pet Zone feeder seemed to give us the best value and we liked the adjustable feature. It was easy to assemble and came with two good quality stainless steel bowls. We are very happy with our purchase and our pet is much more willing to eat/drink, even when she is having some neck stiffness. In our opinion the feeder is serving its purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: James Lange

customer_reviews.title: Okay product. Had to replace it though.
customer_reviews.text: Originally I thought this was the best product I could find to feed my large dog. I didn't want her to bend too much so I needed a feeder that was adjustable. This was a good idea at first, but I ended up not liking it as much. That's because my dog is a messy drinker so she splashes water when she drinks so the water tends to pool around the tray and all over the floor. Also, the feeder leaves that weird white stain that your dish rack gets. I couldn't clean it off, so it looked really gross. I later replaced this product with a Neater Feeder and it was the best decision ever.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: This is great. I love the idea you can adjust the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I love the idea you can adjust the height for my growing, large breed puppy. Arms snap into place easily but make sure you're putting them in right. This may be why some buyers are reporting wobblyness. Personally I do not have this issue. Not at the 8 inch height at least.
customer_reviews.author: Rose ChristoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plastic warps quickly, won't stand up
customer_reviews.text: The plastic where one of the legs snaps into the stand warped after about a month. I was able to snap it back in, but it stayed loose. After two months it won't stand up on its own while my dog eats or drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Levesque

customer_reviews.title: simple, easy to use, BIG bowls
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a great feeding station for growing dogs. adding the legs on is super easy. There's a lip around the holes for the bowls intended to keep water and food in and not fall through the holes when the bowls are lifted/removed (especially important when there's water spillage). HOWEVER, these bowls are HUGE. Understandably, this is to accommodate dogs of all sizes. It's just currently a little awkward for my tiny 3 month old pup to navigate food around a large bowl, but since she's being free-fed, i just fill up her bowl with all the food she'd need for the day, and let her take her time eating. So all-in-all, wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: ngvaynshtok

customer_reviews.title: Amazing buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure of how sturdy this item would be, but the legs snap in securely and easily once lined up. It's attractive (for a dog feeder) and compact enough for my small-ish kitchen. I use it on the medium setting for our medium-sized dog (a short but very strong 40 lob bulldog mix) and it is perfect for her. I am very impressed with this and am sure it will last a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: No for me
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this bowl because it looks nice but unfortunately it is not worth 30 something dollars I paid for it. First of all the bowls are a very thin material I feel like they will be easily banged up (actually have the same ones from the dollar tree). Another thing is the stand itself is not very sturdy and wobbles my dog has bad anxiety and when that stand started wobbling first time she tried it she got scared and never went near it again. Waste of money for me!
customer_reviews.author: Karolina

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased and multi height
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with finding the best raised double bowl feeding option as they were not adjustable. Having the option with this one to use no legs for a few inches of height to using the legs sideways or using the legs fully for higher raising was good for me, as I was unsure what would be best for our new adopted dog. This is made in the USA and requires assembly other than clicking in the legs. The bows are good medium-large size which is helpful to hold water all day during the hot summer. My dog is sloppy drinking and eating so having this tray to hold the bowls is great for avoiding water and food on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: r&m

customer_reviews.title: Works well for all three of my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my tallest dog from laying down to eat. All three dogs took to it quickly and it is a good height for all three with it in set up at the middle height available. Easy to clean. If I had one wish it would be an offer of extra bowls so that while one set is being cleaned and dried the other set could be used. I use both bowls for dry kibble as the dogs (and cat) have a fountain to drink from so I am not dealing with any water being splashed or drooled into the food. Assembly took mere minutes and we were ready to serve dinner.
customer_reviews.author: AnjeleJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my new puppy and it's been working great! I didn't use it on the lowest setting(no legs) But I started it out on the medium height. For an 8wk old puppy it was perfect. He's almost 12wks old now and I'll be changing it to the tallest setting soon. The bowls are high quality. The plastic is fairly sturdy but he did bump into it and flip it over once. So the weight proportions between the stand and the bowls is a little off, so just watch they don't try to carry it away! Very happy for the price I feel it is good quality without paying a ton of money.
customer_reviews.author: jessica jones

customer_reviews.title: Malamute owner-Stand is JUST okay, kinda cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. You basically remove the “legs” and flip them on their sides to make it taller and shorter. I guess I was shopping around too much. Everything clicks into place but it’s so flimsy. For the price I would go with something else. This is cheap plastic and the bowls are no better than what you would find at the dollar store. On the bright side it replaced an ugly old wooden one we had and it matches the rest of the decor so I guess that’s cool. But I have an Alaskan malamute so I’m not sure how long this’ll last. Gonna try it out for a few meals and see how she likes it
customer_reviews.author: Divina

customer_reviews.title: Great! Not 100% stable...?
customer_reviews.text: It definitely needs to be against the wall or your dog may cause it to crash over. Clean it once a week to easily remove stuff that it catches. Wipe. Done. No idea why people complain about how this thing catches stuff... that is fantastic because our dog eats like the food will run away spills all over the place. Sure it looks messy but seriously people would you rather that be on your floor? Shut up and clean it once a week stop being lazy. Funny Note: Our dog has figured out how to collapse this and when his water bowl is empty he pushes both legs in and drags it to us.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value, Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Bought this adjustable feeder trying to be mindful of my dog getting older and the strain it may be putting on her neck to bend down so low every time she eats. It’s a good value for the price, includes the two stainless steel bowls, comes packaged well and is seriously so easy to assemble. I have this Slow feeder bowl from Leash Boss that we really love and it too fits in it so perfectly. I was envisioning this stand to be a little bigger and slightly more sturdy but as time has gone on I’m glad it’s not so big that it doesn’t take up more space. Overall very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tall tray for my boxer. I was apprehensive about the product because it’s made of plastic. After opening, I was impressed with it’s sleek design, adjustable height, sturdiness, and if need be, you can disassemble in a snap and throw it in the dishwasher. The bowls that come with it are an added bonus! The other fantastic thing is that it’s made right here in the USA! I’d definitely recommend this to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Kchnboss

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, but is not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get this because we have two deep-chested dogs. It does its job however, I am unsure for how long. It is not sturdy at all and the plastic is cheap feeling. It does not sit still when the dogs eat from it and it gets knocked over constantly. I thought this would be a quality product based on the price, but we are very disappointed. I'd recommend something else if you're looking for something to elevate your dog bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Not for Medium to Large Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Product description states small, medium and large dogs. It's more suited to small dogs because of its total height, size of bowls and plastic construction. We have two 14 week old Labrador Retrievors who will only be able to use it for probably a month or two. Between being cheaply made and only being useful for a couple of months, the product is overpriced. However, if you have a small dog or dogs, it's probably a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. Versatile height-sturdy-easy to assemble and clean
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our lab puppy. Like other puppies, he goes CRAZY trying to eat the food quickly and ends up pushing all over the sides of the bowls. The dishes look to be nice quality and the plastic frame is sturdy and durable to deal with hyper pups and spills. When the legs are not attached, the base slides more on the floor but the rubber dots on the legs do a better job of preventing it from moving. We have a smaller dog and would absolutely get this for her too if the bowls weren't sized for a large dog. I definitely recommend this for large dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Darby123

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect solution for our puppy who we had no idea ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution for our puppy who we had no idea how big she was going to get since she's a mutt. She is now a year old and weighs about 70lbs standing about 3 and half feet tall (to the top of her head). She definitely needed elevated bowls and these work perfectly. She doesn't have to bend down at all. We haven't had any problems with her knocking it over (it is pushed up against the wall though) and the tray captures the water she sloshes out when she drinks. The stand is easy to assemble and easy to clean when needed. Highly recommend for any taller dog for added meal time comfort.
customer_reviews.author: LotrczySteph

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is so cheap and flimsy that my pup has knocked it over so many times trying to eat or get a drink that I put his other bowls back down on the floor. I wish that I had not ordered thia. Even the stainless steel bowls are thin. very poorly made and definitely not worth the money. Very disappointed. I had to order from another company and spent only 10 dollars more but got a metal stand and it is very sturdy, wish I had gotten it first.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J. McGettrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for Siberian Husky, but hair sticks to it like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time finding a large feeder for my adult Siberian Husky that wasn't way overpriced, and this one definitely fit the "affordable" marker. For less than $25, it's really pretty good quality and feels sturdy enough. He's been using it about a month yet and we haven't had any issues. The only thing I don't like about it is since it is plastic and he's a husky so he sheds constantly, hair static clings to it like crazy. Other than that, it's the only affordable large dog feeder I've found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Huge bowl size, but still a value
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can choose 3 different heights. It is not as sturdy as I thought it would be (I am using the middle height so the arm is actually longer as support. But it’s pretty wobbly. Also, the bowls are HUGE! The amount of food that I put in barely fills the bottom of the bowl! I have a 40lb mid size dog. I can’t imagine what size dog you would have to even fill half that bowl. With that said, I am still happy with the product and I think it is much better for my older dog to eat without bending over so much. I think for the price it was a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: kristen page

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. My dogs and I love these bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these, since I have 3 dogs. Each one is a different height and these are perfect for it. They’re easy to travel with you, the plastic means they’re easy to clean, you can spray them off and go or wipe them down. If you were to damage or lose the inner bowls you could replace them with the dollar store brand and they’ll fit perfectly. I customized mine with each dog’s name on it and gave them a little more personal touch but these are great. They have rubber stoppers at the end so that your dog doesn’t slide them across the room. This is a great product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great feeding station
customer_reviews.text: We have a visiting 2 year old 70 pound lab mix. I was worried that he could have issues as he got older by eating from bowls on the floor. He seems pretty happy with this new arrangement. I recommend putting a small mat (rug) under it to keep it from sliding. I want our furry visitor that arrived with our adult son, who moved back home from another State due to the virus eliminating his job, to have a pleasant stay. This feeding station is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki not Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Your pup will appreciate this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very well made, comes with 2 stainless steel bowls, but we fit Jack's regular bowl in place of one of them. Jackson is a Senior, a tall Labrador Retriever with some Arthritis, and I noticed he was starting to cough a little when eating his meals. He is much more comfortable being able to eat without bending way down! My only regret is I did not get this sooner, it really makes a big difference! Don't hesitate like me, just get it for your dog, whether he's a senior or just a pup.
customer_reviews.author: Tex, Stef & Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with mobility problems
customer_reviews.text: My dog has Osteo-arthritis and has difficulty with his back legs, in addition to the obvious problem of difficult movement, he was not able to eat from his bowl on the floor. This adjustable raised dual tray with twin stainless steel bowls is the perfect solution. I bought two sets, one in the kitchen and one in my home office where my dog keeps me company. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: P. MACK

customer_reviews.title: Easy elevated dog bowls
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60-lb golden retriever in a small apartment, and this works well for us. I needed something lightweight but sturdy, and I like that these are adjustable so I can change my mind about just *how* elevated I want her bowls to be. These bowls are a good size for my dog, and I would think any smaller dog. The water bowl may be a bit small for the larger dogs. I included photos of her bowls on the tallest setting, which aesthetically I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 2 labs
customer_reviews.text: I’m so impressed! I have 2 labs that are 7 months old (50 and 60 pounds). They were sliding on the wood floors when they bent down into inhale their food as well as choking and coughing. I snapped this thing together in 5 seconds. The tallest setting almost too tall for them right now, but it’s better than eating off the floor and it will be fine for them as they grow. And it hardly even wobbled while both of them were gobbling up their dinner! Very impressed with the quality for an inexpensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great product & idea
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you have a gentle fur baby like me that doesn't gobble food! I have it up against the counters to ensure more stability also! But it works great for my fur baby! Doesn't wobble or fall over easily! She has not knocked it over yet! For gobble eaters this may not be the case! I would imagine it would rock fairly easily & could be knocked over if they're in a hurry to eat! But a wonderful product & idea for taller fur babies who are gentle & not in competition for food!
customer_reviews.author: cchelle127

customer_reviews.title: English lab outgrew it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my English lab puppy. It’s easy to assemble and you can take it with you on vacations. I took this with us on a camping trip and worked fine for that. Unfortunately My puppy is now 10 months and 90+ pounds so it’s no longer tall enough for him. I still use the bowls but will need to size up to a larger size. If you are looking for a long term keep, I would recommend for medium sized dogs. However I would measure first to make sure before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Gracy

customer_reviews.title: works for my 84lb boxer/Doberman mix
customer_reviews.text: My big girl suddenly started picking up her water bowls,full of water, and playing with them. She is an 84lb Boxer/St.Bernard/Doberman mix with 6 cup bowls so you can imagine the messes I was cleaning up. In 2 days I was searching the internet for answers and found raised bowls,then this. I am quite pleased with this product. It has with stood her (she is 13 mts old) and her 'busy' behavior. Very easy to assemble also. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Nice not to have our lab bend over to eat ...
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and is what I expected as I had seen the product at my daughter's. Nice not to have our lab bend over to eat or drink - much more comfortable for him. Went together quickly with no problems. You can use the supports lengthwise to make it tall or on the longer side and have them "lay down" to make it shorter. It is heavy plastic but seems like it will hold up well and is sturdy. Bowls are stainless and holding up well after a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dogs! Makes eating/drinking easier
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my lab to use. Was tired of her eating and drinking with the bowls on the floor. It looked like it was a strain for her to use so decided to get these to make it more comfortable. One thing that is great about this product is that you have a couple different options for The height. The bowls are easy to clean and are stainless steel. The hard plastic also seems very durable and also easy to clean. It’s light, it’s functional and my dog really seems to like it using it. What else can I ask for? Def am a fan!
customer_reviews.author: Sliderguy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant to give this product above four stars, but after placing it securely against a wall as the other reviewers recommended - I came to find a successful product that works well. The two bowls are easy to clean and have stayed perfect. I like that they arent too shallow or deep because it means our two dogs always have access to fresh water and food. The lip beneath the bowls secures them to the plastic base to prevent leaks. The plastic legs are a bit flimsy but the slip proof pads do work wonders; havent had any real issues yet. Even our cats can reach up and get water if they want.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my older big dog who is having joint problems. She doesn't have to work as hard to bend down to eat or drink anymore. It's definitely made things easier than my old bowls. The only drawback is that the bowls are so shiny it's hard to tell what the water level is. The bowls drop right in and can be lifted out for easy cleaning. I've never had a problem with the bowls or the table design. Very glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Big boi
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a big boi. I felt bad that he had to reach so far down to get his food, because he's a big boi. The doodle now only has to slightly tilt his head down on the highest setting. He is a good boi who likes good boi food stands made for good Bois. He says that the quality is decent but not great. He also says I didn't pay that much so what should I expect. You have to stagger the pedestals otherwise the water bowl will tip over the whole thing. Good boi uses all day long. Big bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: The height is adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure where the height should be for my 110lb dog, but she actually preferred it on the medium height. and it was easy to assemble. You really don't need instructions. Also it was mailed very quickly. Regarding the easy to clean: it may take your dog some time to adjust to the height, if they have never used an elevated eating surface. Overall: a great product & love the flexibility of the design and the clean lines.
customer_reviews.author: A Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product
customer_reviews.text: The product is light so easy to move (especially on tile) and water from the dish tends to pool on the surface under lip of water bowl (better on the surface than floor though). Our big boy makes a mess with water. The water is easy enough to dry when cleaning the water dish. A weighted bowl or base may reduce movement. The product is very easy to assemble and our boy loves it. I like the adjustable factor as well. Overall a great product and I would purchase again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud Tighiouart

customer_reviews.title: Just what my dogs needed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my two dogs. Previously I just had a bowl on the floor but noticed they had to lean down quite a bit to reach the water. Also they would splash some water around due to the position of the bowl and angle of their neck. This bowl with the included elevated stand gives them easier access to water while eliminating neck strain. The stand looks nice as well and so far have not had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L.

customer_reviews.title: No. Too flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like it. My dog knocked it over everytime I fed him. There is a lip around each bowl to hold them in place. The water and food gets trapped there so it’s hard to clean. Also the food gets in that lip, so the dog would knock it over trying to lick the food out of the lip. The water bowl would dump on the floor all over the kitchen each time he knocked it over. The only bonus was my floor getting mopped several times a day. Way to flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Joslyn

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Practical, & Decently Priced
customer_reviews.text: Portable (collapsible and lightweight), practical, and decently priced. I'm pretty glad I found this product during my search for an elevated dog bowl stand. It's pretty versatile and practical for almost any dog breed, and compared to most other similar products out there, much more affordable considering its versatility. I like the fact that it's adjustable to suit your dog's needs and can grow with your pup. We have a medium size dog (27-30 lbs), and it's a perfect fit for her in its tallest configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Kim

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy material
customer_reviews.text: It’s very flimsy and not sturdy at all. I was hoping for heavy material so that it wouldn’t be easily moveable. It’s a little short for my Great Danes, but it’s better than them eating on the floor. The fact that it comes with the stainless steel bowls makes the buy worth it. One single stainless steel bowl at Petsmart is around $12. So the price for this system is great. But you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Heiser

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!! PERFECT for any pet owner
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 Sheltie's & 1 diabetic dachshund. Well the dachshund can't have the Sheltie's food, so making this higher out of her reach is awesome. Plus it is better on our Sheltie's eating their food raised up VS on the floor Win, Win all the way around. Highly recommend to any animal owner
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA B.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our bulldog
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before I picked this dog bowl table. It is perfect for what we needed. Our English Bulldog has a hard time bending down to the floor to eat so we had to get something taller for him. This is great because there are 2 different heights you can set it to. Our Chihuahua can reach it easily, and so can the cats. It isn't super sturdy but our dogs aren't too rough so it's fine as long as it's up against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl set!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the stand. The plastic is quite durable and feels rubber like. The legs snap in very securely and is so easy to do. The bowls are a little on the thin side and one I received has some tiny dents on the bottom. They are made in India, so although the box said Made in USA, the bowls have a made in India sticker. The bowl size is large which is nice, especially in the summer. I don't need to worry about it not being filled with water. I wanted to give 5 stars, but I couldn't because of the dents in one bowl but overall, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Oh So Sparkly

customer_reviews.title: Not for large/giant breeds
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my English mastiff puppy. Its fine for smaller to medium size dogs for sure. And you can't beat the price. Its a little flimsy but if you have it up against a wall its totally fine. This will get me through the puppy stage and that's about it. Its way too small for a mastiff. Plus I like to leave food out at all times and he just gobbles it up. Hes 3 months old / 40 lbs and on the medium setting.
customer_reviews.author: Daria

customer_reviews.title: Well made, attractive and functional
customer_reviews.text: I spent much time looking at all raised feeder options before I chose this item. The only drawbacks that I saw were that it was plastic, and that it looked a tad flimsy. However, NOT true. It IS plastic, but hard(not brittle) and heavy duty. Was extremely simple to put together, and not flimsy. Other reviews stated that it is even more sturdy placed against a wall. True. And thank you for the tip. Changing the height is very easy and it becomes even more sturdy. And it's easy to maintain-looks good. Price point for the product quality is excellent. I have three dogs and will buy two more!
customer_reviews.author: Belalinda

customer_reviews.title: I like that the height is easily adjusted to suit my dog’s needs
customer_reviews.text: I have it set at it’s tallest for my senior English Setter and it works well for her. If her needs change, it is easily lowered. It wipes clean wipe a swipe of a sponge, keeps bowls from being pushed around and looks pretty nice. An extremely rambunctious doggy may knock it over if it is an enthusiastic eater. It includes two stainless steel bowls. My current bowls also work. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: a human

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: It comes apart easily to clean it but that same benefit has a bit of a drawback. My girl is a very enthusiastic eater and this wobbles when she's eating which makes her uncomfortable. It you put it at the tallest setting it's even less sturdy but it does help her eat without slipping now which is a plus. The legs can come off a bit easier than I expected but if you have it up against a wall or a counter it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tt71

customer_reviews.title: A clever and resourceful product
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these — one for my malamute and the other for a bassethound. Came on time and was packaged well. Size large was perfect for my mal. Medium fit just right for the basset. I think as long as the feeders are against a wall, or corner, they are sturdy enough. My mal has yet to knock it over, and he’s quite strong! The bowls are much larger in diameter than I expected. Can fit a lot of water or food. Overall, I’m very pleased. It was simple and easy to put together. I love that it’s adjustable. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, tips easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have a black lab that is a rescue and is skiddish at times. The bowls move easily when she moves, and it scares her, so she stops eating. She also has tipped it over many times while eating. There is a lip on the top where the bowls go that ALWAYS catches water. It's easy to take apart and put together, but it isn't good for dogs that are easily scared or larger and can knock it over. It tips pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie-Lee

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old dog loves this feeder. No longer bending over to eat, he seems much more comfortable and happy. The only reason I didn't rate it 5-star is because it can tip over, but not easily. He stumbles sometimes and has fallen into it and it will dump over and water spills out. That's only happened a couple of times, so it's not a big deal. If you place it next to a wall, it wouldn't be an issue at all. Much easier for me, too! I'm older and it keeps me from bending down so far to pick up the bowls to refill. The price was great! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb M Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight
customer_reviews.text: I love the size it’s a great concept. My large 5 month old puppy constantly knocks it over, its light weight and all he needs to do is put a paw on one side and everything dumps over. It would be perfect if it was heavier at the bottom so he cannot flip it over. I’m gonna have to buying something else for him because this is just is not going to work. I think it’ll be great for older train dogs or smaller dogs my big pawed baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elderly Dog
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our labrador seemed to have trouble bending down to the ground to eat and drink from his bowls. It seems to be working, he doesn't have to put all his weight on his front shoulders (he has arthritis). I thought the bowls would be a bit bigger, I don't didn't properly measure his previous bowls. It's pretty stable but it you bump into it, it's wobbly. If it works for our labbie then it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bowl stand works for its intended purpose, however it is not that sturdy. It sways when my dog eats causing the water bowls to spill over, so now I only fill water half way. Update: A few weeks of use and I had to take off the riser supports due to water overflow all the time. When my 45 pound dog eats the water sloshes over the edges, even when only half full. I don’t recommend this product unless you have it flat on the floor. Unfortunately this negates the raised food benefits for my pooch.
customer_reviews.author: James Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for large dogs and too flimsy of a design
customer_reviews.text: Way too small for a large dog. I have a 100+ lb lab. I wanted to find something to raise her bowls. This frame is wobbly plastic. The bowls are probably fine for small dogs, but for my 100 lb lab, I’m constantly filling her water with this. Plus, she’s a sloppy drinker, so the water pools in the bowl tray and all over the floor and wall since it splashes now that it’s higher. Trying to clean the water out of the tray is just a mess. Upset that this was almost $30.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeytree

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder for bigger pups!
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened this, I was concerned that it might not be sturdy enough for my giant (90 pound!) dog. But I had nothing to worry about. It hasn’t moved an inch, and the only water spilled has come from his dribbly lips. It’s also great for future enormous pups that are still growing. With the height being adjustable, it grows along with them. The bowls come out easily for cleaning, and the holder is easy to wipe down. We’ve been really happy with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bezner

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and almost cancelled my ordered before receiving the order. However, I decided to give the stand a try. Yes it’s made of plastic and may seem a tad bit wobbly at first but once I set it down against the wall with the water bowl filled and food dish in it, it is fine. It was also easy to assemble which is a plus. Water does gather at the top when your dog laps out of it but isn’t that what it’s supposed to do? Overall I think the stand is nice and my dog looked kind of surprised when he didn’t have to bend over to eat the first evening. It’s worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Geri Oldham

customer_reviews.title: Love this stand
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand! I originally built one myself out of a wooden crate and cut holes to fit the bowls into.. We stored his food in the crate, until he figured out that he can rip the wooden rings off of it to get the food out! (dogs... am I right) Anyway, I have a 60+ lb pit bull and this is the perfect height for him. I have it up against the wall and of course he knocks it a bit because he eats SUPER fast. So far I have not had any issues with it! I will update the review if i find rust or water damage like previous reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Lora D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I take my dog to the office every morning and bought this less expensive feeder so he can eat comfortably when he's there. This easy to assemble feeder allows Fury to reach his food without stretching or straining his neck. It also keeps the bowls stationary unlike before where his bowl was sliding all over the floor as he ate. So, we're happy with this product. It assembled in seconds and serves its purpose perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: George Haskoor

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall dogs
customer_reviews.text: I'd debated about this feeder for awhile. I'd hesitated because I was worried the bowls might be too small, or that it wouldn't be stable, but those fears were unfounded. My dog is about 24" at the shoulders and weighs about 65#. She's never tipped it over or shoved it around the room. There are little rubber feet to keep it from sliding around. It's nice to be able to pop the bowls in the dishwasher. I bought this several months ago, and we've had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: No Go
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these, 1 for each dog. The female would not even go near it. The male would drink water but not eat the food. Bowls are very flimsy thin & they rattle when the dogs try to eat their food, most likley why the one dog doesn't like to eat out of them. I would not recommend them to a friend. They are no use to me or the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: George Webster

customer_reviews.title: Love this! If you're looking to simply raise your ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! If you're looking to simply raise your pets food off of the ground this is the product for you. We love it. It's the perfect size and although it is plastic, its extremely durable and very sturdy. I have a one year old German Shepherd/lab mix who is very energetic and rambunctious and he hasn't knocked this over. He is a messy eater/drinker and the whole thing is so easy to clean. The bowls are great, good size and quality and the design of the feeder makes it easy to remove them for cleaning. Love this product and would recommend it 10/10 times. Don't waste your time searching for other products, trust me--this is exactly what you need!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Doggie Bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the bowls are a very large in size and the tray that they sit in appears to be tip proof as it is sitting on the floor without the the extenders to raise it off the floor. I cannot attest to anything beyond that as I have yet to raise it off the floor since my puppy is still small. It is a very sturdy and attractive looking bowl set. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Love

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap crappy product.
customer_reviews.text: I knew by the price that I obviously wasn’t buying the best product on the market, however this is beyond sad. I took it out of the box and put it together and it can’t even stand up straight! It’s so cheap and flimsy and literally crooked when it’s standing up. I immediately took it back apart and packed it back up to return.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my growing puppy! I'm not sure what breed he is, but I didn't want to buy a food stand until I had an idea if he was done growing. This food stand is perfect because it can be adjusted to 3 different height for puppy growth stages. I was worried about it not being sturdy because its mostly plastic, but holds his food and water well. The bowls are HUGE too.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my Great Dane so he wouldn’t be so uncomfortable eating so low to the ground. He loves it! So I bought another one the next day for our Lab. He’s 4 years old and I wasn’t sure how he would do with it since it’s something new. And he had no problem with the transition. I think he actually loves it too! My Great Dane is still young and a crazy eater and the feeder can get a little wobbly but that’s just because he’s like a bull in a china shop! I plan on ordering another one for my daughters Lab soon! Just looks a lot more comfortable for them.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer braswell

customer_reviews.title: Love the adjustable heights and a tray that catches water.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one to purchase so the answer to the obvious question is yes. I would buy it again. I liked the adjustable height as I tend to have various size dogs and I want them all to have their food bowl at an ergonomic height. The tray the dishes sit in catch any food or in my case water that the dog laps over. The tray catches a lot of water which our Sheltie needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Danz

customer_reviews.title: good for small dog/non messy eater
customer_reviews.text: this was fine for my terrier and bichon but it's not sturdy enough for my lab and golden retriever puppy. My dogs are messy eater/drinker so the kibble would fly into the water bowl and the water would splash and get stuck on the surface/groove. Stuff doesn't come off easily if I ran it under a faucet, I really have to scrub it due to stuff get stuck in the groove.
customer_reviews.author: tien nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: My Husky has arthritis in her hips and seemed to be struggling with bending down so low to the floor to eat and drink. This elevated feeder has been a game changer for her! She's actually drinking more water and finishing her food now, which is amazing. Very happy with this product! However, the bowls seem a little thin and not very strong but we will see how they last over time.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Marie

customer_reviews.title: Clean underneath and where the bowls sit often!
customer_reviews.text: I have a really big dog so these bowls keep him from having to hunch over to eat which is great! It was super easy to assemble and only took a few minutes. It’s the perfect height for him. However, if you don’t clean it often it will get very disgusting fast. Especially if your dog likes to spill water like mine does. I usually have to take it outside and use the hose to clean it just to make sure nothing is caked on or underneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tips Easily
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Border Collie who has gotten really funky about eating. Thought it might help. The bowls are great but the design of the stand is cheap and lightweight. We had to put it tightly against the wall to keep it upright and even then she still tips it over when eating. We can no longer keep water in the bowl because she tips it over so often and I am tired of cleaning up water all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Mystique69

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with how much my dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this stand. It is just the right height for my 80lb amstaff, and while it does sway a bit when he is eating because we don't have it against a wall, we have never had any issues with it falling, or even worried about it. My pup wont eat out of metal bowls and the bowls need to have a lip so we just put his ceramic bowl inside of the ones included with this and it works fine. If you are looking for a reasonably priced elevated stand i recommend this one. As long as your dog isn't a super excited eater it will do its job well!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel petznik

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy at full height for a big puppy
customer_reviews.text: I'd say overall this is a great little adjustable height food bowl. I bought it for a large puppy, and it went straight to full height from the get-go. Being a puppy, he's nearly toppled it several times while eating, because it does tend to flex when pushed at the full height. I think this would better for a older or gentler dog if the full height is needed. I'll probably just reinforce it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Proudly advertises "made in USA".........
customer_reviews.text: .........then you get it and find "made in India" on the bottom of the two, flimsiest bowls one could imagine. I have a large pup, so I assembled it to its maximum height, and it's quite wobbly. I'm going to lower it to the middle height and hope that will make it less so. I'm rating it now because I can't imagine it being worse than it already is.
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be bigger
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for all dog sizes and ages except the bowls are a bit small so I am refilling the water constantly - a lot more than a large bowl would have me doing. This is medium size. Also one of the bowls came with a hole in it and it was made in India. I was too lazy to return it so I just use the one with the hole in it for the food and the solid one for the water.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Shalit

customer_reviews.title: Great bowls for great price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 6 months old ChowChow because his neck fur is always wet after drinking. It has 3 different levels and we’re using the 2nd one it’s perfect. He did not like the bowls that came with it for some reason, they had a smell after being wet but we already had better bowl so no problem there I just switched them out. It’s easy to clean, looks nice and no more wet neck and around on the floor. Yes I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Senada2006

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost a year now. It is still in good shape and it was very easy to change the sizes. My only complaint is that it constantly looks dirty. Even when I wash it with soap and water in the sink, it dries with these white spots. I have tried hand drying to see if maybe they're water spots, to no avail. Since this is pretty well hidden in our house and I'm confident it's clean, its not a huge deal. If this doesn't bug you, I would definitely recommend this product for how easy to use it is.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Functional if not beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I bought the prettier elevated dog dish holders made from scrolled iron that are available on Amazon and one of them broke after only a few months, so I got this cheaper set of elevated bowls. They seem to work fine and are a good height at the lower setting for my small Shepard so I am happy so far. They keep my dog feeding area neat and are easy to clean. The plastic is kinda ugly, I wish they were bamboo, but they are good for the price I paid and matched my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Calloo Callay

customer_reviews.title: Love that it's adjustable
customer_reviews.text: When deciding on a raised feeder for my dog I was surprised to discover he needed it lower than I originally thought. He is a 55 lb. pitbull mix and I intended to use the feeder at the highest setting, but discovered he needed the middle one. He had a front leg amputated and this makes it easier for him to stand and eat. I am glad I chose the adjustable feeder because I would have bought one that was too high. The feeder works great, is not super sturdy but it is fine against the wall, may not work well for a more active dog that might try to knock it over. For us, it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!  Ozzy loves his new dining table.
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't we buy this thing years ago and let our pet eat from the bowl sitting on the floor? Constant mess we had to clean up, plus inconvenient for him. Now - everyone is happy! Ozzy is happy, our floor is clean and as an added benefit Ozzy's food container and a scoop fit neatly underneath his new dining table. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Schlemazl Beerbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great elevated dish for the money
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 month old pup has been eating out of dishes on the floor up until yesterday he always looked at my adult dog in envy when he realized that he didn't have to eat off a floor. Well now he feels like a big dog and proud to be eatibg out of an elevated dog dish. Only downside is it isn't all that sturdy. He ran into it and one of the legs collapsed but then again it was 30 lbs running full speed towards it. I know half the time my legs want to give out
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good design. Too light weight and tippy
customer_reviews.text: I like the design. It looks nice and the recessed bowls are set in such a way that smashed water is caught in the tray, not on the floor. The major flaw is this tips too easily. I had to drive a drywall screw through the base into the kitchen floor to keep it from tipping over when the dog or cat uses it. I wouldn't recommend using this without securing it to something.
customer_reviews.author: mlitty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made product at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the sturdiness of this double dog bowl kit. My dog suffers from a collapsing trachea and I am trying to find everything that will help him avoid exacerbating a fit of coughing. This brings the bowls up to him avoiding the need for him to lower his head. He's a 25lb. Cavachon and it is perfect for him at the middle elevation. There is still a higher level for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for cats and dogs alike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product for both cats and dogs to use. I have a 115 pound dog and a 4 pound cat and they both can drink out of this with relative ease. The only issue is that my cat also enjoys hiding underneath the platform and often knocks the bowls, which creates water to pool around the bowls. Otherwise, this is a wonderful and easy to use idea!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This elevated dog bowl works, is very light weight. However, I was hoping for something a little stronger. Easy to knock over, no weight to it at all. Will keep for the price but will be looking for a new elevated dog bowl within a year.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie10

product_meta.title: Pet Zone Designer Diner ADJUSTABLE Elevated Dog Bowls - Adjusts To 3 Heights, 2.75”, 8", & 12'' (Raised Dog Dish with Double Stainless Steel Bowls)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackYour dog will be eating in chic comfort with the Pet Zone designer Diner, designed to close the distance between your dog and their food and water, thereby reducing strain on their neck and joints. Elevated Feeding also encourages effective digestion and may reduce instances of gastrointestinal problems such as bloat. The feeder accommodates small, medium, and large dogs by adjusting from 2. 75 inches; to 8 inches; to 12 inches high. It grows with your dog from puppyhood to their adult years! When not in use, The legs can be easily removed and tucked under the feeding platform for easy storage. Set up the feeder when needed, then put it away for a neater, clutter-free space. The designer Diner includes two stainless-steel, rust-resistant bowls that are dishwasher safe for easy cleaning and maintenance. The legs of the stylish frame are outfitted with non-slip pads to prevent tipping and skidding, and the spill ridge on the raised dog bowl keeps food and water off of the floor.
feature_bullets: IDEAL FOR ALL LIFE STAGES: Designer Diner is one dog bowl for all life stages. This dog bowl adjusts to a 12-inch elevated dog bowl for large dogs, an 8-inch elevated dog bowls for medium dogs and a 2.75-inch bowl for small dogs.
HEALTHY DINING EXPERIENCE: Elevated dog food dish provides a healthy feeding position that aids digestion.

VERSATILE AND SAFE: When not in use, the legs can be easily removed and tucked under the feeding platform for easy storage. Set up the feeder when needed, then put it away for a neater, clutter-free space.
RUST RESISTANT AND EASY TO CLEAN: The Designer Diner includes two stainless-steel, rust-resistant bowls that are dishwasher safe for easy cleaning and maintenance.
REDUCE JOINT STRESS: Using a raised dog feeder helps to reduce stress on joints and bones – this makes our elevated dog bowls perfect for more mature dogs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
